Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Contents of the attached PDF are not rendered using PdfRenderer in Android versions below 8.0" (#1485) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Run the attached replication sample in Android versions 6 or 7. The sample uses Android.Graphics.PDF.PdfRenderer to convert the first page of the PDF to image and display it on an ImageView. 2. Compare the rendering of the contents with the PDF as viewed in Adobe Reader or the same sample in Android 8. [SimplePdfRenderer1.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1855105/SimplePdfRenderer1.zip) ### Expected Behavior The contents of the first page fully rendered. Please refer the below image. ### Actual Behavior The contents of the first page not fully rendered. Please refer the below image. ### Version Information Correct behavior: Android 8 Incorrect behavior: Android 6 and Android 7 Devices tested in: Samsung Galaxy Tab A (Android 6), Moto G5S(Android 7) and Google Pixel XL(Android 8) ### Log File

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[libzip-windows] use libzip.dll and zlib.dll from NuGet" (#877) at xamarin/xamarin-android

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[mono-sdks] Use for armeabi, armeabi-v7a, arm64-v8a, x86, x86_64, host-Darwin, host-Linux, llvm32 and llvm64" (#1320) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "[Mono.Android] remove LINQ usage in ResourceIdManager" (#1487) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
There were quite a few LINQ expressions in here, that could be rewritten
to simple `foreach` loops. The new code should have fewer allocations.

I also updated the usage of `MethodInfo.Invoke` to use `CreateDelegate`
instead, as it is an order of magnitude faster to call the method in
this way.

Lastly, I added a null check to the return value of `GetMethod`, because
it is *technically* possible for a class to exist with the
`ResourceDesignerAttribute` but be missing an `UpdateIdValues` method.

These changes should give us a *very slight* performance improvement to
startup.

**[WIP] DO NOT MERGE**

Implements a new approach to generating code to access layout elements from within the application source. Generates a "binding" class which can be instantiated with an Activity or View instance passed to it and its properties can be used to find the associated views. The code is **NOT** feature complete yet. Tests are missing as well, so are the docs.

Events.RelatedBody:

The code is **NOT** feature complete yet. Tests are missing as well, so are the docs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Mono.Android] remove LINQ usage in Android.Runtime.JNINativeWrapper" (#1486) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
A LINQ expression was used for succinctness in the `CreateDelegate`
method.

It turns out that this method could get called alot in a Xamarin.Android
application, so it seems it could be worthwhile to port the LINQ code to
an equivalent for-loop.

This change should slightly decrease the number of allocations during
startup.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PushModalAsync on first run causes ObjectDisposedException for PlatformRenderer in iOS" (#2208) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I am developing an Android / iOS app that show's data from a client's CRM system. When attempting to show a notification in a popup modal, on iOS there is an ObjectDisposedException thrown. This only occurs when the app is first installed. If the app is being restarted, it does not occur. I have attempted to reproduce the issue in a vanilla project but have been unable to replicate the issue.

There is no issue in Android.

[Exception Output.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1858621/Exception.Output.txt)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a TabbedPage
2. On ContentPage as a tab, attempt to open another ContentPage as a Modal Popup.

### Expected Behavior
Show a ContentPage as a popup

### Actual Behavior
App crashes with an ObjectDisposedException

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 v15.6.4
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  11.2
  - Android: 8.1
- Affected Devices: iOS Devices

### Reproduction Link
Source can be provided privately

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Font aliasing and color aren't displayed correctly in MacOS without a retina display" (#2204) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Font aliasing and color aren't displayed correctly in MacOS without a retina display. They both work well in native code.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the attachment, compile and run on a Mac computer without retina display (or in an older monitor attached to it)

### Expected Behavior

- Colors matching RGB
- Fonts with correct aliasing, or at least in a readable way.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0
- Last known good version: None released; but nightly solves the color issue.
- IDE: VS 2017 latest
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - MacOS
- Affected Devices: any MacOS without retina displays

### Screenshots
See attachments color-issue and font-issue.

### Issue details

We are applying RGB colors in Xamarin.Forms, and it works perfectly on UWP, but rather strange on Mac. In fact, the colors on Mac seem lighter than expected. In the picture, last window is the Xamarin.Forms.

Is this an expected behavior? Should we start adjusting Hue, Sat and Luminosity altogether?
Here are the sample codes for both Xamarin.Forms and native applications:

#### Xamarin.Forms
```
    <StackLayout HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
        <StackLayout x:Name="teste" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand" BackgroundColor="#32d2c8">
            …
        </StackLayout>
    </StackLayout>
```
#### Native
```
                        <subviews>
                            <box >
                                <rect key="frame" x="0.0" y="0.0" width="480" height="270"/>
                                <autoresizingMask key="autoresizingMask" flexibleMaxX="YES" flexibleMinY="YES"/>
                                …
                                <color key="fillColor" red="0.1960784314" green="0.82352941180000006" blue="0.7843137255" alpha="1" colorSpace="custom" customColorSpace="sRGB"/>
                            </box>
```

On the font issue, we are using custom fonts for our application, and we noticed that whenever we use them with a small font size (say 11), they appear to be pixelated and, sometimes, we can barely read it. To demonstrate it, we downloaded one of our fonts (Segore WP Light) and one provided by Apple (SF Pro Display), putting them site-by-side on both Xamarin.Forms and native applications. The result was clear: on the native application, the fonts are rendered perfectly, whereas in Xamarin.Forms they get pixelated (Apple’s font is better rendered, but still presents some cracks and pixels).

However, if we increase the font size (say 14), the problem goes away. Moreover, if we use the Mac system native fonts the problem is not presented. 
So the question is: should we have an additional care for fonts alien to the Mac OS system? Could we solve this somehow in Xamarin.Forms?

Sample code snippet:

#### Xamarin.Forms
```
            <Label FontSize="11" Text="Welcome to Xamarin Forms!" FontFamily="Segoe WP Light" VerticalOptions="Center" HorizontalOptions="Center" TextColor="White" />
            <Label FontSize="11" Text="Welcome to Xamarin Forms!" FontFamily="SF Pro Display" VerticalOptions="Center" HorizontalOptions="Center" TextColor="White" />
```
#### Native
```
                                        <textField horizontalHuggingPriority="251" verticalHuggingPriority="750" fixedFrame="YES" translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints="NO" id="sdr-ex-IXh">
                                            <rect key="frame" x="165" y="235" width="149" height="22"/>
                                            <autoresizingMask key="autoresizingMask" flexibleMaxX="YES" flexibleMinY="YES"/>
                                            <textFieldCell key="cell" scrollable="YES" lineBreakMode="clipping" sendsActionOnEndEditing="YES" alignment="center" title="Welcome to Xamarin Forms!" id="myO-YS-RLq">
                                                <font key="font" size="11" name="SegoeWP-Light"/>
                                                <color key="textColor" name="controlBackgroundColor" catalog="System" colorSpace="catalog"/>
                                                <color key="backgroundColor" white="1" alpha="0.0" colorSpace="deviceWhite"/>
                                            </textFieldCell>
                                        </textField>
                                        <textField horizontalHuggingPriority="251" verticalHuggingPriority="750" fixedFrame="YES" translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints="NO" id="3ew-qC-fwm">
                                            <rect key="frame" x="170" y="211" width="139" height="22"/>
                                            <autoresizingMask key="autoresizingMask" flexibleMaxX="YES" flexibleMinY="YES"/>
                                            <textFieldCell key="cell" scrollable="YES" lineBreakMode="clipping" sendsActionOnEndEditing="YES" alignment="center" title="Welcome to Xamarin Forms!" id="f6e-Eh-Wvu">
                                                <font key="font" size="11" name="SFProDisplay-Regular"/>
                                                <color key="textColor" name="controlBackgroundColor" catalog="System" colorSpace="catalog"/>
                                                <color key="backgroundColor" white="1" alpha="0.0" colorSpace="deviceWhite"/>
                                            </textFieldCell>
                                        </textField>
```

I've grouped in a single issue because, after doing some investigation in code and past issues, I believe they're related, but let me know if you prefer to split in two.

X
[POCFonts.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1857817/POCFonts.zip)
![font-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44371/38057211-0cb218ca-32b5-11e8-8eec-2196c4e9b7b4.jpg)
![color-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44371/38057212-0cd04b24-32b5-11e8-9999-ebd349710a43.jpg)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListView hides first item after scrolling to bottom on Xamarin.Forms iOS side" (#1751) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

ListView within a StackLayout in a ContentPage does not scroll all the way to the top on iOS yet works fine on Android.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Tap on a ListView item.
2. Scroll to the bottom of the ListView.
3. Scroll back to the top of the ListView.

### Expected Behavior

Scroll all the way to the top of the ListView to see the very first item.

### Actual Behavior

Scroll all the way to the top of the ListView, on removing the finger from the screen, ListView automatically scrolls down hiding the first item.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 2.3.4.267
- Last known good version: No idea, long time issue
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac Community 7.3.3 Build 7
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  11.2
  - Android:  7.1
- Affected Devices: iPhone 5C, iPhone SE, iPhone 7 Plus

### Videos and Reproduction Link

[movies_and_xaml.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1678857/movies_and_xaml.zip)
Zip above contains two videos showcasing the problem and the original xaml page (without the xaml.cs codebehind file).

### Other info

Tried to test on more recent Xamarin.Forms versions without success, kept getting an error on compile. Haven't had time yet to set up a project reproducing the problem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[iOS] Race condition between the main thread and a thread used by CADisplayLinkTicker" (#1755) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Map renderer giving 0 size with MoveToRegion" (#1852) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Android map renderer giving 0 size for Map
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a custom map
2. Move away from the map
3. Come back to the map

### Expected Behavior
The renderer displays the map

### Actual Behavior
Xamarin.Forms MapRenderer: MoveToRegion exception: Java.Lang.IllegalStateException: Error using newLatLngBounds(LatLngBounds, int): Map size can't be 0. Most likely, layout has not yet occured for the map view.  Either wait until layout has occurred or use newLatLngBounds(LatLngBounds, int, int, int) which allows you to specify the map's dimensions.
  at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw () [0x0000c] in <fcbf47a04b2e4d90beafbae627e1fca4>:0 
  at Java.Interop.JniEnvironment+InstanceMethods.CallVoidMethod (Java.Interop.JniObjectReference instance, Java.Interop.JniMethodInfo method, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* args) [0x00069] in <402ad96b56e643ccbd17e513ae1b6078>:0 
  at Android.Runtime.JNIEnv.CallVoidMethod (System.IntPtr jobject, System.IntPtr jmethod, Android.Runtime.JValue* parms) [0x0000e] in <183d469964214eae9915d97180f9356f>:0 
  at Android.Gms.Maps.GoogleMap.MoveCamera (Android.Gms.Maps.CameraUpdate update) [0x00048] in <bcb3af9a0115492baaa7a2e17d504257>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Android.MapRenderer.MoveToRegion (Xamarin.Forms.Maps.MapSpan span, System.Boolean animate) [0x000c5] in <5930f5b120c94ff2aae31bb1351fbfd2>:0 
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.122203
- Last known good version: (first reported in 2.3.4)
- IDE: VS for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: Min - API 15, Target 26
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms-2.5.0.122203, Xam.Forms.Maps-2.5.0.122203
- Affected Devices: Android phones

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Customizing the NavigationBar in Xamarin form at Content Page Label (UWP)" (#2068) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
I am developing a Xamarin form application in which we are customizing the ToolBarItems added to NavigationPage. 

-- Setting the below property in XAMARIN.UWP is hiding the default EllipsisButton so i can place my own Toolbar items.
 <Style x:Key="EllipsisButton" TargetType="Button">
            <Setter Property="MaxWidth" Value="0"/>
  </Style>
But the above is behaving for the application label. 
I am pushing a new ContentPage as Modal Async on the Navigation and adding the toolbarItems  but not able to see the toolbar items in this current Cntent page.

Navigation bar is visible but the Toolbaritems is showing as empty so user will not be able to understand which Toolbaritems action is clicked.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. 
2. 
3. 

### Expected Behavior
The added toolbaritems should be showed along with the icon and title.
### Actual Behavior
Navgation bar is shown with empty ToolbarItems
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NSSetUncaughtExceptionHandler class lack" (#3829) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/1409609-nssetuncaughtexceptionhandler?preferredLanguage=occ
```
void UncaughtExceptionHandler(NSException *exception) {
    NSArray *callStack = [exception callStackSymbols];
    NSString *reason = [exception reason];
    NSString *name = [exception name];
}

- (BOOL)application:(UIApplication *)application didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:(NSDictionary *)launchOptions {
    NSSetUncaughtExceptionHandler(&UncaughtExceptionHandler);
    return YES;
}
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Question: Building from release tarballs" (#3820) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to Releases and download a source tarball/zip file for a tagged release (for example, [`xamarin-mac-4.2.1.28`](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/releases/tag/xamarin-mac-4.2.1.28)).
2. Unpack the tarball.
3. Attempt to run `make reset-versions`. Watch the build fail due to the lack of a git checkout.

### Expected Behavior

There should be some way to build Xamarin.Mac from a release source tarball.

### Actual Behavior

You can’t do this.

### Possible Solutions

Would it be possible to manually repack the repository such that all the submodules are included in the release tarball, so that the (very large) tarball would be all you need to build? As it stands today you cannot build from a release version _at all_.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "mono-symbolicate errors (on iOS only): "Warning: MVID directory does not exist: ..."" (#3653) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

 We have several Xamarin.Forms apps that are instrumented with the HockeyApp SDK to send crash reports. The build environment is Visual Studio 2017 on Windows 10 with local builds for android and remote builds to a Mac for iOS builds. We've recently gotten the android versions to build in such a way that they produce the needed .mSym files and have been successful in using mono-symbolicate to view the filenames and line numbers from stack traces sent to HockeyApp for production builds. For iOS, on the build server in the `"~/Library/Caches/Xamarin/mtbs/builds/<ourApp>/<someGuid>/bin/iPhone/Ad-Hoc/<ourApp>.mSYM"` directory, there are a bunch of sub-directories. But when we run mono-symbolicate, every sub-directory that it's looking for isn't found. So each line of the input stack trace produces an error `"Warning: MVID directory does not exist: <someSubDirectory>"`. Example error line:

`Warning: MVID directory does not exist: /Users/derek.wheeler/Library/Caches/Xamarin/mtbs/builds/FieldSheet.iOS/b5f6c442719e634bde4b19906949135b/bin/iPhone/Ad-Hoc/FieldSheet.app.mSYM/1861ef8a8a87467c9c37202d50ff68b2
  at FieldSheet.Pages.ConnectionSettingsPage.TestAppCrash () <0x100925550 + 0x0001f> in <1861ef8a8a87467c9c37202d50ff68b2#d25ebbac98c60d1ed35df16528c08be6>:0`

Of note too, we get a build warning that sounds like a problem producing the mSYM stuff:

1>C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Xamarin\iOS\Xamarin.iOS.Common.targets(777,3): warning : Aot files could not be copied to the destination directory /Users/derek.wheeler/Library/Caches/Xamarin/mtbs/builds/FieldSheet.iOS/b5f6c442719e634bde4b19906949135b/obj/iPhone/Ad-Hoc/mtouch-cache/64/Build/Msym/Msym/tmp: Could not start process.

We've tried a bunch of different build options but couldn't find a definitive source for this so we were basically just guessing. The latest version from the iOS csproj:

`
<PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Ad-Hoc|iPhone' ">
    <DebugType>pdbonly</DebugType>
    <Optimize>True</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\iPhone\Ad-Hoc</OutputPath>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <ConsolePause>False</ConsolePause>
    <MtouchArch>ARMv7, ARM64</MtouchArch>
    <BuildIpa>True</BuildIpa>
    <CodesignKey>...redacted...</CodesignKey>
    <CodesignEntitlements>Entitlements.plist</CodesignEntitlements>
    <GenerateSerializationAssemblies>Off</GenerateSerializationAssemblies>
    <DebugSymbols>True</DebugSymbols>
    <MonoSymbolArchive>True</MonoSymbolArchive>
    <MtouchEnableSGenConc>false</MtouchEnableSGenConc>
</PropertyGroup>
`

### Steps to Reproduce

see Description

### Expected Behavior

mono-symbolicate should be able to show filenames and line numbers for Ad-Hoc iOS builds

### Actual Behavior

mono-symbolicate shows errors

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin=4.8.0.760
- Last known good version: This is the first time we're trying this. 
- IDE: Visual Studio Enterprise 2015, Version 14.0.25425.01 Update 3
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:   Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Mac SDK = 11.6.1.4 (db807ec)

### Screenshots

### Reproduction Link

> VS bug [#588941](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/588941), VS bug [#591266](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/591266)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mtouch] Use full path to mono-symbolicate instead of UseShellExecute" (#3825) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Fix https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3653 differently as
`UseShellExecute` cannot be used when redirecting output so the original
fix [1] caused an exception which affected it from both macOS and windows
(thru XMA) instead of being an issue only with the later.

It's not clear how the original [1] fix was validated successfully, it's
possible than an older version of mono did not throw (since that
limitation seems windows specific).

[1] https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/3781

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Could not AOT the assembly System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll (MT3001)" (#3199) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new Cross-Platform Xamarin.Forms .NET Standard 2.0 project in Visual Studio (i used 2017 PC).
2. Open this project in Visual Studio for Mac.
